chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This document is intended to help you to migrate an existing Exadel JSF or Struts projects into JBoss Developer Studio. Preferences can be exported from Eclipse 3.2.0 (3.2.1 or 3.2.2) and imported in Eclipse 3.4.x by the standard Eclipse means.

section.title: Key Features of Projects Migration to JBoss Developer Studio
section.para: For a start, we propose you to look through the table of main features of migrating projects to JBoss Developer Studio:

table.title: Key Features of Project Migration to JBoss Developer Studio

entry.para: It simplifies the process of bringing your existing JSF applications into your JBoss Developer Studio workspace as JSF projects. The import is possible with *.war files.

row.entry: Migration of JSF project and Migration of JSF project from *.war file

entry.para: It simplifies the process of bringing your existing Struts applications into your JBoss Developer Studio workspace as Struts projects. The import is possible with *.war files.

row.entry: Migration of Struts project and Migration of Struts project from *.war file

section.title: Other relevant resources on the topic
section.para: All JBoss Developer Studio/JBoss Tools release documentation you can find athttp://docs.jboss.org/tools in the corresponding release directory.
The latest documentation builds are available at http://download.jboss.org/jbosstools/nightly-docs.
